newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH PRESIDENT SEALS POLLS FOR SEPTEMBER 21.
newsitem.headline: POLISH PRESIDENT SEALS POLLS FOR SEPTEMBER 21.

text.p: Polish President Aleksander Kwasniewski signed an official resolution on Wednesday confirming the date of the general elections at September 21, the presidential press office said.
Under the regulation, political parties will have until September 1 to register candidates for the lower of house of parliament and the senate with the State Electoral Commission.
Free time on public radio and television for the parties will start on September 6, it said.

The elections will pit the co-ruling ex-communist Democratic Left Alliance (SLD) against the rightist Solidarity Election Action (AWS), with opinion polls showing about 25 percent of support for each of the groups.
